subject: Re: [Radiance-general] light leaks
body:
Ignacio, If you read the IES file in a text editor, you will see the
bottom portion of the file is mostly 0 values, but with several 0.1 and
0.2 mixed in.  This is either erratic values in the photometry, or
demonstration of actual light leaks from the fixture as it was measured.
It does not appear to be a result of any Radiance parameters.

-Chris

-----Original Message-----
[mailto:radiance-general-bounces@radiance-online.org] On Behalf Of
Ignacio Munarriz
Sent: Monday, 04 February, 2008 7:50 AM
To: Radiance general discussion
Testing an asimetric photometric file with rview appears these light
leaks www.aisarquitectura.com\archivos\phot.jpg , i've found them in
several tests i don't know if it  can be a  parameters error or a ies
problem...
here it's the ies source www.aisarquitectura.com\archivos\bega.ies
saludos
ignacio
